speaker: Son
text_entry: SCENE III. England. Before the King's palace.

speaker: Son
text_entry: Enter MALCOLM and MACDUFF

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Let us seek out some desolate shade, and there

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Weep our sad bosoms empty.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Let us rather

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Hold fast the mortal sword, and like good men

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Bestride our down-fall'n birthdom: each new morn

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: New widows howl, new orphans cry, new sorrows

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Strike heaven on the face, that it resounds

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: As if it felt with Scotland and yell'd out

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Like syllable of dolour.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: What I believe I'll wail,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: What know believe, and what I can redress,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: As I shall find the time to friend, I will.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: What you have spoke, it may be so perchance.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: This tyrant, whose sole name blisters our tongues,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Was once thought honest: you have loved him well.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: He hath not touch'd you yet. I am young;

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: but something

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: You may deserve of him through me, and wisdom

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: To offer up a weak poor innocent lamb

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: To appease an angry god.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: I am not treacherous.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: But Macbeth is.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: A good and virtuous nature may recoil

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: In an imperial charge. But I shall crave

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: your pardon;

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: That which you are my thoughts cannot transpose:

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Angels are bright still, though the brightest fell;

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Though all things foul would wear the brows of grace,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Yet grace must still look so.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: I have lost my hopes.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Perchance even there where I did find my doubts.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Why in that rawness left you wife and child,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Those precious motives, those strong knots of love,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Without leave-taking? I pray you,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Let not my jealousies be your dishonours,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: But mine own safeties. You may be rightly just,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Whatever I shall think.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Bleed, bleed, poor country!

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Great tyranny! lay thou thy basis sure,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: For goodness dare not cheque thee: wear thou

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: thy wrongs;

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: The title is affeer'd! Fare thee well, lord:

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: I would not be the villain that thou think'st

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: For the whole space that's in the tyrant's grasp,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: And the rich East to boot.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Be not offended:

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: I speak not as in absolute fear of you.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: I think our country sinks beneath the yoke;

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: It weeps, it bleeds; and each new day a gash

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Is added to her wounds: I think withal

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: There would be hands uplifted in my right;

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: And here from gracious England have I offer

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Of goodly thousands: but, for all this,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: When I shall tread upon the tyrant's head,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Or wear it on my sword, yet my poor country

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Shall have more vices than it had before,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: More suffer and more sundry ways than ever,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: By him that shall succeed.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: What should he be?

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: It is myself I mean: in whom I know

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: All the particulars of vice so grafted

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: That, when they shall be open'd, black Macbeth

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Will seem as pure as snow, and the poor state

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Esteem him as a lamb, being compared

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: With my confineless harms.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Not in the legions

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Of horrid hell can come a devil more damn'd

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: In evils to top Macbeth.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: I grant him bloody,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Luxurious, avaricious, false, deceitful,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Sudden, malicious, smacking of every sin

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: That has a name: but there's no bottom, none,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: In my voluptuousness: your wives, your daughters,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Your matrons and your maids, could not fill up

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: The cistern of my lust, and my desire

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: All continent impediments would o'erbear

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: That did oppose my will: better Macbeth

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Than such an one to reign.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Boundless intemperance

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: In nature is a tyranny; it hath been

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: The untimely emptying of the happy throne

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: And fall of many kings. But fear not yet

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: To take upon you what is yours: you may

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Convey your pleasures in a spacious plenty,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: And yet seem cold, the time you may so hoodwink.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: We have willing dames enough: there cannot be

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: That vulture in you, to devour so many

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: As will to greatness dedicate themselves,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Finding it so inclined.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: With this there grows

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: In my most ill-composed affection such

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: A stanchless avarice that, were I king,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: I should cut off the nobles for their lands,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Desire his jewels and this other's house:

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: And my more-having would be as a sauce

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: To make me hunger more; that I should forge

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Quarrels unjust against the good and loyal,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Destroying them for wealth.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: This avarice

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Sticks deeper, grows with more pernicious root

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Than summer-seeming lust, and it hath been

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: The sword of our slain kings: yet do not fear;

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Scotland hath foisons to fill up your will.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Of your mere own: all these are portable,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: With other graces weigh'd.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: But I have none: the king-becoming graces,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: As justice, verity, temperance, stableness,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Bounty, perseverance, mercy, lowliness,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Devotion, patience, courage, fortitude,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: I have no relish of them, but abound

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: In the division of each several crime,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Acting it many ways. Nay, had I power, I should

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Pour the sweet milk of concord into hell,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Uproar the universal peace, confound

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: All unity on earth.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: O Scotland, Scotland!

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: If such a one be fit to govern, speak:

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: I am as I have spoken.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Fit to govern!

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: No, not to live. O nation miserable,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: With an untitled tyrant bloody-scepter'd,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: When shalt thou see thy wholesome days again,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Since that the truest issue of thy throne

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: By his own interdiction stands accursed,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: And does blaspheme his breed? Thy royal father

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Was a most sainted king: the queen that bore thee,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Oftener upon her knees than on her feet,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Died every day she lived. Fare thee well!

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: These evils thou repeat'st upon thyself

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Have banish'd me from Scotland. O my breast,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Thy hope ends here!

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Macduff, this noble passion,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Child of integrity, hath from my soul

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Wiped the black scruples, reconciled my thoughts

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: To thy good truth and honour. Devilish Macbeth

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: By many of these trains hath sought to win me

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Into his power, and modest wisdom plucks me

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: From over-credulous haste: but God above

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Deal between thee and me! for even now

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: I put myself to thy direction, and

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Unspeak mine own detraction, here abjure

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: The taints and blames I laid upon myself,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: For strangers to my nature. I am yet

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Unknown to woman, never was forsworn,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Scarcely have coveted what was mine own,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: At no time broke my faith, would not betray

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: The devil to his fellow and delight

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: No less in truth than life: my first false speaking

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Was this upon myself: what I am truly,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Is thine and my poor country's to command:

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Whither indeed, before thy here-approach,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Old Siward, with ten thousand warlike men,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Already at a point, was setting forth.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Now we'll together; and the chance of goodness

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Be like our warranted quarrel! Why are you silent?

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Such welcome and unwelcome things at once

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: 'Tis hard to reconcile.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Enter a Doctor

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Well; more anon.--Comes the king forth, I pray you?

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Ay, sir; there are a crew of wretched souls

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: That stay his cure: their malady convinces

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: The great assay of art; but at his touch--

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: Such sanctity hath heaven given his hand--

speaker: Doctor
text_entry: They presently amend.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: I thank you, doctor.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Exit Doctor

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: What's the disease he means?

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: 'Tis call'd the evil:

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: A most miraculous work in this good king;

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Which often, since my here-remain in England,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: I have seen him do. How he solicits heaven,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Himself best knows: but strangely-visited people,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: All swoln and ulcerous, pitiful to the eye,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: The mere despair of surgery, he cures,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Hanging a golden stamp about their necks,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Put on with holy prayers: and 'tis spoken,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: To the succeeding royalty he leaves

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: The healing benediction. With this strange virtue,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: He hath a heavenly gift of prophecy,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: And sundry blessings hang about his throne,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: That speak him full of grace.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Enter ROSS

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: See, who comes here?

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: My countryman; but yet I know him not.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: My ever-gentle cousin, welcome hither.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: I know him now. Good God, betimes remove

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: The means that makes us strangers!

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Sir, amen.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Stands Scotland where it did?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Alas, poor country!

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Almost afraid to know itself. It cannot

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Be call'd our mother, but our grave; where nothing,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: But who knows nothing, is once seen to smile;

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Where sighs and groans and shrieks that rend the air

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Are made, not mark'd; where violent sorrow seems

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: A modern ecstasy; the dead man's knell

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Is there scarce ask'd for who; and good men's lives

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Expire before the flowers in their caps,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Dying or ere they sicken.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: O, relation

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Too nice, and yet too true!

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: What's the newest grief?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: That of an hour's age doth hiss the speaker:

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Each minute teems a new one.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: How does my wife?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Why, well.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: And all my children?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Well too.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: The tyrant has not batter'd at their peace?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: No; they were well at peace when I did leave 'em.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: But not a niggard of your speech: how goes't?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: When I came hither to transport the tidings,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Which I have heavily borne, there ran a rumour

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Of many worthy fellows that were out;

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Which was to my belief witness'd the rather,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: For that I saw the tyrant's power a-foot:

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Now is the time of help; your eye in Scotland

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Would create soldiers, make our women fight,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: To doff their dire distresses.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Be't their comfort

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: We are coming thither: gracious England hath

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Lent us good Siward and ten thousand men;

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: An older and a better soldier none

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: That Christendom gives out.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Would I could answer

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: This comfort with the like! But I have words

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: That would be howl'd out in the desert air,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Where hearing should not latch them.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: What concern they?

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: The general cause? or is it a fee-grief

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Due to some single breast?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: No mind that's honest

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: But in it shares some woe; though the main part

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Pertains to you alone.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: If it be mine,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Keep it not from me, quickly let me have it.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Let not your ears despise my tongue for ever,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Which shall possess them with the heaviest sound

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: That ever yet they heard.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Hum! I guess at it.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Your castle is surprised; your wife and babes

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Savagely slaughter'd: to relate the manner,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Were, on the quarry of these murder'd deer,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: To add the death of you.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Merciful heaven!

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: What, man! ne'er pull your hat upon your brows;

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Give sorrow words: the grief that does not speak

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Whispers the o'er-fraught heart and bids it break.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: My children too?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Wife, children, servants, all

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: That could be found.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: And I must be from thence!

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: My wife kill'd too?

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: I have said.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Be comforted:

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Let's make us medicines of our great revenge,

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: To cure this deadly grief.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: He has no children. All my pretty ones?

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Did you say all? O hell-kite! All?

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: What, all my pretty chickens and their dam

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: At one fell swoop?

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Dispute it like a man.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: I shall do so;

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: But I must also feel it as a man:

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: I cannot but remember such things were,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: That were most precious to me. Did heaven look on,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: And would not take their part? Sinful Macduff,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: They were all struck for thee! naught that I am,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Not for their own demerits, but for mine,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Fell slaughter on their souls. Heaven rest them now!

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Be this the whetstone of your sword: let grief

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Convert to anger; blunt not the heart, enrage it.

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: O, I could play the woman with mine eyes

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: And braggart with my tongue! But, gentle heavens,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Cut short all intermission; front to front

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Bring thou this fiend of Scotland and myself;

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Within my sword's length set him; if he 'scape,

speaker: MACDUFF
text_entry: Heaven forgive him too!

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: This tune goes manly.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Come, go we to the king; our power is ready;

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Our lack is nothing but our leave; Macbeth

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Is ripe for shaking, and the powers above

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Put on their instruments. Receive what cheer you may:

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: The night is long that never finds the day.

speaker: MALCOLM
text_entry: Exeunt
